Protocols/LGV_SwipeTabViewControllerType.name: mySwipeTabViewController
Protocols/LGV_SwipeTabViewControllerType.abstract: This references the “owning” LGV_SwipeTabViewController instance. It is required, and should usually be implemented as a weak reference.

Protocols/LGV_SwipeTabViewControllerType.name: myTabItem
Protocols/LGV_SwipeTabViewControllerType.abstract: An accessor for the tab item. This may return nil, but the tab controller won’t add your view controller, if it does not have it.

Protocols/LGV_SwipeTabViewControllerType.name: LGV_SwipeTabViewControllerType
Protocols/LGV_SwipeTabViewControllerType.abstract: Any view controller that we add to our tab controller, should conform to this protocol.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: toolbarOnTop
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: This is true (default is false), if we want the “Tab Bar” to show up on top of the screen (as opposed to the default bottom).

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: textOnRight
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: This is true (default is false), if we want the “Tab Bar” items to show the text on the right of each item (as opposed to the default bottom).

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: viewControllerIDs
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: This needs to be populated, if you want to add view controllers programmatically, but using the storyboard.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: generatedViewControllers
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: This needs to be overridden, if you want to add view controllers programmatically, without using the storyboard.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: pageViewController
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: This is the page view controller that will allow swiped tabs.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: toolbar
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: This is the toolbar, at the top or bottom.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: Called when the view hierarchy has been set up.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: viewWillLayoutSubviews()
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: Called, when the layout will be changed.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: styleToolbar()
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: Override this, to provide your own toolbar styling.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: selectViewController(at:)
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: Called to select a specific view controller.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: pageViewController(_:viewControllerBefore:)
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: Called to provide a new view controller, when swiping.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.name: pageViewController(_:viewControllerAfter:)
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html#.abstract: Called to provide a new view controller, when swiping.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTab_Base_ViewController.name: mySwipeTabViewController
Classes/LGV_SwipeTab_Base_ViewController.abstract: This is the “owning” “Tab” controller for this instance.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTab_Base_ViewController.name: navigationController
Classes/LGV_SwipeTab_Base_ViewController.abstract: We might use our container’s navigation controller, if we didn’t specify one.

Classes.html#/c:@M@SwipeTabController@ob.name: SwipeTabSegue
Classes.html#/c:@M@SwipeTabController@ob.abstract: This gives us a class to use for custom segues.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTab_Base_ViewController.name: LGV_SwipeTab_Base_ViewController
Classes/LGV_SwipeTab_Base_ViewController.abstract: This is a class that conforms to the LGV_SwipeTabViewControllerType protocol, and is also a basic UIViewController.

Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html.name: LGV_SwipeTabViewController
Classes/LGV_SwipeTabViewController.html.abstract: This implements an instance of a UIPageViewController, as well as a UIToolbar instance. The toolbar acts in the same manner as a UITabBar,
